question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure the code you provide is executable for demonstration. Vue2 integration with DJI drone RTMP streaming complete solution (Windows 64 system)

checklist.title: Is the Vue2 application properly structured with RTMP streaming integration?
checklist.description: Review whether the code properly structures a Vue2 application with components that handle RTMP streaming from DJI drones. Check if the application includes the necessary video player component (like vue-video-player or flv.js) configured correctly for RTMP streams. Score 0 if the core video streaming functionality is not implemented, 5 if basic streaming is implemented but with configuration issues, and 10 if the implementation is complete with proper component architecture and stream handling.

checklist.title: Is the DJI SDK integration properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code correctly implements integration with the DJI Windows SDK. Check if the solution includes proper initialization of the DJI SDK, drone connection management, error handling, and permission management for Windows. Verify if the code handles SDK version compatibility (particularly for Windows 64-bit systems). Deduct 5 points if drone discovery mechanism is missing, and 3 points if error handling for connection failures is inadequate. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the RTMP stream generation and management properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes a complete solution for generating RTMP streams from DJI drone camera feed. Verify if it includes configuration for an RTMP server (like Nginx with RTMP module or Node-Media-Server), proper stream key generation, and stream health monitoring. Deduct 5 points if no stream quality configuration options are provided, and 3 points if there's no mechanism to handle stream interruptions. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the solution include a complete Windows-specific implementation?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code specifically addresses Windows 64-bit system requirements, including appropriate native module bindings, Windows-specific file path handling, and proper system resource management. Check for Windows permission handling for camera/USB access required by DJI drones. Deduct 5 points if the solution doesn't handle Windows-specific configuration, and 3 points if it doesn't manage Windows system resources properly. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as drone connection loss, RTMP server failures, network interruptions, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Real-time video analysis and object detection 2. Multi-drone stream switching 3. Picture-in-picture mode for comparison feeds). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple video player instances handling the same stream) 2. Function modules unrelated to drone streaming (e.g., unrelated social sharing features) 3. Fancy effects that affect streaming performance (e.g., unnecessary video filters that increase CPU usage). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating drone communication/RTMP server/frontend view layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size â‰¥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the streaming performance optimized for real-time operation?
checklist.description: Judge whether the streaming implementation meets real-time requirements: 1) Latency under 500ms for video feed 2) UI responsiveness maintained during active streaming 3) Efficient resource usage (CPU/memory) on Windows 64-bit systems. Deduct 5 points for each second of stream delay beyond 1 second, 3 points for UI freezing during streaming operations, and 5 points if memory usage grows unchecked during extended operation. The full score is 10 points.
